i1.name: Goes_Where_He_Pleases
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' {{stil|health regeneration|regenerates}} an additional{{ft|{{as|{{pp|1 to 2|key=%}} of his '''maximum''' health}} every 5 seconds.|{{as|{{pp|1/5 to 2/5|key=%}} of his '''maximum''' health}} each second.}}

{{sbc|Passive:}} Periodically, '''Dr. Mundo''' gains immunity to the {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effects of the next hostile spell to affect him. Upon resisting one, '''Dr. Mundo''' pays a {{as|health cost}} equal to {{as|7% of his '''current''' health}} and propels a canister that lands 525 units in the general direction of its source, remaining on the ground for 7 seconds.

'''Dr. Mundo''' can move near the canister to consume it, {{tip|heal|healing}} himself for {{as|8% of his '''maximum''' health}} and reducing the {{sti|cooldown}} of ''Goes Where He Pleases'' by 15 seconds. Enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} can move near it to destroy it.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Dr. Mundo Unknown value: stil / health regeneration / regenerates an additional
Passive: Periodically, Dr. Mundo gains immunity to the immobilizing effects of the next hostile spell to affect him. Upon resisting one, Dr. Mundo pays a health cost equal to 7% of his current health and propels a canister that lands 525 units in the general direction of its source, remaining on the ground for 7 seconds.
Dr. Mundo can move near the canister to consume it, healing himself for 8% of his maximum health and reducing the cooldown of Goes Where He Pleases by 15 seconds. Enemy champions can move near it to destroy it.
Goes Where He Pleases' cooldown resets upon respawn.
i1.notes:
* Upon being triggered by a hostile {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effects, ''Goes Where He Pleases'' will also grant '''Dr. Mundo''' immunity to additional immobilizing effects from the same {{tip|cast instance}}.
** Abilities where non-immobilizing effects and damage are nested into immobilizing ones will have them also prevented. Non-immobilizing effects and damage applied separately (the vast majority of cases) are not prevented.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} and {{ai|Black Shield|Morgana}} take priority over ''Goes Where He Pleases''.
* ''Goes Where He Pleases'' will not trigger against nor resist {{cais|R|Rell}} {{tip|kinematics|ongoing kinematic effect}}.
** It will trigger against and prevent the ability's initial {{tip|airborne|displacement}}, but even in that case, not prevent the continous effect.
* The canister, whether in flight and on the ground, will transition in and out of {{cai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}} alongside ''Dr. Mundo''.{{bug|2}}
* The canister cannot be interacted with while {{tip|untargetable}}.

q1.name: Infected_Bonesaw
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' throws an infected bonesaw in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slows}} them by 40% for 2 seconds.
''Infected Bonesaw'' has a minimum damage threshold, and is capped against {{tip|monsters}}.
If the bonesaw hits an enemy, '''Dr. Mundo''' {{tip|heals}} for 50% of the {{as|health cost}}, increased to 100% against {{tip|champions}} or {{tip|monsters}}.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Dr. Mundo throws an infected bonesaw in the target direction that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and slows them by 40% for 2 seconds.
Infected Bonesaw has a minimum damage threshold, and is capped against monsters.
If the bonesaw hits an enemy, Dr. Mundo heals for 50% of the health cost, increased to 100% against champions or monsters.
q1.notes:
{{Effect at cast time start}}
* {{tip|Spell shield}} blocking the ability's effects on the enemy does not prevent '''Dr. Mundo''' from receiving the health cost refund.
q1.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  {{as|50|health}} as 50 and riot's value 0,0,0,0,0 as 0

effects.str: • Magic Damage: % of target's current health

• Minimum Damage:
  • Capped Monster Damage:

w1.name: Heart_Zapper
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' charges up a defibrillator for up-to 4 seconds, dealing {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.25}} seconds to nearby enemies and storing a portion of the {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} he takes as [[Health#Grey health|grey health]] on his [[health bar]].
''Heart Zapper'' can be recast after 1 second within the duration, and does so automatically after the duration.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' detonates the defibrillator, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies and {{tip|heal|heals}} for 50% of [[Health#Grey health|grey health]], increased to 100% if at least one enemy {{tip|champion}} or large {{tip|monster}} is hit.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Dr. Mundo charges up a defibrillator for up-to 4 seconds, dealing magic damage every 0.25 seconds to nearby enemies and storing a portion of the post-mitigation damage he takes as Health#Grey health on his health bar.
Heart Zapper can be recast after 1 second within the duration, and does so automatically after the duration.
Recast: Dr. Mundo detonates the defibrillator, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies and heals for 50% of Health#Grey health, increased to 100% if at least one enemy champion or large monster is hit.
leveling:
{{st|Magic Damage per Tick|{{ap|5 to 20}}|Total Magic Damage|{{ap|5*16 to 20*16}}}}
{{st|Damage Stored|{{ap|25 to 45}}% of damage taken}}
w1.notes:
* The charge up applies {{tip|persistent area damage}} and the detonation deals {{tip|area damage}}.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will only block the detonation.
* ''Heart Zapper'' will occasionally deal an additional tick of damage.{{bug}}
* ''Heart Zapper'' and its recast will buffer and cast at the end of {{ais|Infected Bonesaw|Dr. Mundo}} cast time if attempted to cast during it.
** As with all buffering of this type, another input such as a movement command can override the buffering of the spell again.
w1.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  {{as|5%|health}} as 5 and riot's value 0,0,0,0,0 as 0

e1.name: Blunt_Force_Trauma
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' gains {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}, plus an additional amount based on his {{as|'''missing''' health}}, reaching maximum value at {{as|70% '''missing''' health}}.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo's''' next basic attack within 4 seconds is empowered to have an {{tip|uncancelable windup}}, gain {{sti|50 '''bonus''' range}}, and deal {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, increased by {{pp|key=%|key1=%|type='''missing''' health|0 to 60 for 11|0 to 40|color=health|formula=1.5% per 1% of '''missing''' health, capped at 40% '''missing''' health}}. If the target dies or is a small {{tip|monster}}, they are sent flying away in a line, though not through terrain, causing all enemies they pass through to take {{as|100% AD}} plus ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' minimum '''bonus''' damage.
''Blunt Force Trauma'' as well as the triggering {{as|attack's damage}} is increased to 200% against {{tip|minions}} and non-epic {{tip|monsters}}.
''Blunt Force Trauma'' {{tip|basic attack reset|resets}} '''Dr. Mundo's''' basic attack timer.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Dr. Mundo gains bonus attack damage, plus an additional amount based on his missing health, reaching maximum value at 70% missing health.
Active: Dr. Mundo's next basic attack within 4 seconds is empowered to have an uncancelable windup, gain 50 bonus range, and deal bonus physical damage, increased by 0 to 40 ‒ undefined. If the target dies or is a small monster, they are sent flying away in a line, though not through terrain, causing all enemies they pass through to take 100% AD plus Blunt Force Trauma's minimum bonus damage.
Blunt Force Trauma as well as the triggering attack's damage is increased to 200% against minions and non-epic monsters.
Blunt Force Trauma resets Dr. Mundo's basic attack timer.
leveling:
{{st|Bonus AD|{{ap|15 to 35}}}}
{{st|Maximum Additional Bonus AD|{{ap|25 to 45}}|Maximum Total Bonus AD|{{ap|15+25 to 35+45}}}}
{{st|Minimum Bonus Physical Damage|{{ap|5 to 45}} {{as|(+ 7% '''bonus''' health)}}|Maximum Bonus Physical Damage|{{ap|5*1.6 to 45*1.6}} {{as|(+ {{ap|7*1.6}}% '''bonus''' health)}}}}

{{st|Minimum Non-Champion Bonus Damage|{{ap|5*2 to 45*2}} {{as|(+ {{ap|7*2}}% '''bonus''' health)}}|Maximum Non-Champion Bonus Damage|{{ap|5*1.6*2 to 45*1.6*2}} {{as|(+ {{ap|7*1.6*2}}% '''bonus''' health)}}}}
e1.notes:
* ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' attack deals {{tip|spell damage}}, while the target's body being shoved deals {{tip|area damage}} to enemies it passes through.
* ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' attack works against [[structures]], consuming the buff and dealing its full damage.
* ''Blunt Force Trauma'' cannot knock back {{tip|wards}}, [[structures]] or epic {{tip|monsters}} it kills, nor champions that enter a {{tip|zombie state}} upon dying.
* Targets flung away are rendered {{tip|untargetable}} in the process.
* The damage of the enemy's corpse colliding with enemies does not benefit from ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' attack {{tip|critical strike|critically striking}}.
e1.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  {{as|{{ap|10 to 50}}|health}} as 10/20/30/40/50 and riot's value 0,0,0,0,0 as 0

r1.name: Maximum_Dosage
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' injects himself with chemicals to become enhanced for 10 seconds, gaining increased {{sti|health|{{as|'''base''' health}}}}, {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}}, {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, and {{sti|health regeneration|regenerating}} {{as|health}}.
r1.descriptionHtml: Active: Dr. Mundo injects himself with chemicals to become enhanced for 10 seconds, gaining increased base health, bonus attack damage, bonus movement speed, and regenerating health.
r1.notes:
* The health regeneration granted by ''Maximum Dosage'' adjusts dynamically to '''Dr. Mundo's''' {{as|'''maximum''' health}}.
* ''Maximum Dosage'' will end prematurely upon entering {{tip|resurrection}}.
* {{pending for test}} ''Maximum Dosage'' continuous effect is not affected by {{ri|Revitalize}} as it is [[health regeneration]].
* Apart from visually expanding '''Dr. Mundo's''' body, ''Maximum Dosage'' does '''not''' grant increased [[size]].
